text: Hi! I have some questions about custom modules: 1.) Is it possible to integrate the smart rules options here? If not: is this on the roadmap?  2.) how can I prefill option fields (in the CMS) for a custom module with values e.g. based on HubDB entries or values like all membership lists?
1.no but sometimes a bug makes it kinda possible, though haven’t tried using that in production. it is planned. No ETA
is the form coming in in an iframe?

Hi! Let me know if this is the wrong channel for this.
I have been using HubSpot for the past 6 months and manage my company's website on it. I find myself coding on my local machine, but having to change the CSS to match some of the HubSpot classes that get added when using Hubl code.
Those who build sites on their local machines, what is your workflow to get it on HubSpot? (Mine is copy paste right now).
Updating old files on my local machine is a nightmare as I have to keep track of the lines I change as to not re change ALL my classes to match the hubl generated code. There must be a better workflow:sweat:

This repo is a good start: <https://github.com/Absanater/HubSpot-frontend-local>

I’ve took inspiration from it and done something more complicated with also support to modules
but can’t share as I did for the company where I work now
can you talk about what that more complicated was? i mean not in detail just "general" info?

I can edit multiple templates and modules, have a browsersync instance for testing all the pages I’m editing proxying local file with the online one, so for only sass and js edit I don’t have to publish on HubSpot anything
Thanks <@UFH0PPMEW>, that was very helpful. I'll test it out.
I just stumbled upon this thread. Adding it here incase someone has similar issues

Just for info, this is the structure of src on my project for HubSpot.

Into the tasks folder there are all the thing related to Gulp + Webpack :slightly_smiling_face:
doesnt look like you can work on modules with this

With the project I linked above you can’t.

In mine I’ve added a Gulp task to get modules from ftp, edit them locally and then put online from ftp

for everything else I just use the API
someday, i will have time to set that up...:(
